meanings.definition: Superlative form of bend, meaning able to bend the most easily or to the greatest extent.
meanings.sent1: The rubber band was the bendiest of all, stretching without breaking.
meanings.sent2: Among all the straws, the bendiest one could twist into various shapes.
meanings.sent3: The bendiest tree in the forest could wave hello to passing animals.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was the bendiest, adapting to new ideas effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The bendiest road in town curved around the mountain, offering breathtaking views.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of bend, meaning more flexible or pliable than others.
meanings.sent1: The bendiest ruler in the classroom could wrap around a pencil.
meanings.sent2: She chose the bendiest straw to sip her drink with ease.
meanings.sent3: The bendiest wire in the box decided to do a little dance.
meanings.sent4: His arguments were the bendiest, always finding a way to convince others.
meanings.sent5: The bendiest fabric draped beautifully, flowing like a gentle stream.
